data.name: ErrorBlankPassword
data.value: Unfortunately, Windows does not allow tasks to be scheduled by local users with no password. You cannot schedule a backup unless you first set a password for your logon account.
data.comment: Displayed if user has no Windows logon password.

data.name: ErrorInvalidPassword
data.value: That password is not correct.
data.comment: Possible error message when testing user password.

data.name: ErrorMsgTitle
data.value: Schedule Backup Error
data.comment: Title for all backup scheduler error message boxes.

data.name: ErrorValidatingPassword
data.value: Therefore the password could not be tested.
data.comment: Possible error message when testing user password.

data.name: ERROR_ACCOUNT_LOCKED_OUT
data.value: Your account is currently locked out and may not be logged on to.
data.comment: Possible error message when testing user password.

data.name: ERROR_DOMAIN_CONTROLLER_NOT_FOUND
data.value: The domain controller for this domain could not be found.
data.comment: Possible error message when testing user password.

data.name: ERROR_PASSWORD_MUST_CHANGE
data.value: The system has flagged your password as needing to be changed before logging on.
data.comment: Possible error message when testing user password.

data.name: MsgDeleteExistingTask
data.value: Do you want to stop using the existing backup schedule? Press Yes to stop it, or No to leave it unchanged.
data.comment: Displayed when user presses cancel on backup task scheduler dialog.

data.name: MsgTitle
data.value: Schedule Backup
data.comment: Title for all message backup scheduler message boxes.

data.name: ErrorNoScript
data.value: The script file used to run the backup at scheduled times cannot be found. Backups cannot be scheduled.
data.comment: Displayed when backup.vbs is missing or unlocatable.

data.name: ErrorUnknownPasswordProblem
data.value: Unknown error {0} while testing password.
data.comment: Possible error message when testing user password.

data.name: MsgCurrentSchedule
data.value: Backups are currently scheduled to run as follows:
data.comment: Introduction to summary of current backup schedule.

data.name: SIL_Icon
data.value: ..\Resources\SIL.ico;System.Drawing.Icon, System.Drawing, Version=2.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a

data.name: ErrorSchedulerService
data.value: Unable to ensure that the Windows Task Scheduler service is running. Therefore backups cannot be scheduled.
data.comment: Message displayed for any problem while ensuring Task Scheduler is running (for FW backups).

data.name: ErrorNoTask
data.value: Could not create a backup schedule.
data.comment: Displayed when a new scheduled task could not be created.

data.name: MsgOtherSchedulers
data.value: The following users have already scheduled backups:
data.comment: Displayed when other users are discovered to have created backup schedules.

data.name: MsgOtherSchedulersAddendum
data.value: (If you wish to edit or delete the other schedules, you should open Scheduled Tasks via the Control Panel, or see a system administrator.)
data.comment: Displayed when other users are discovered to have created backup schedules.

data.name: MsgOtherSchedulersAndMe
data.value: Press OK to edit just your schedule. Press Cancel if you do not wish to edit your schedule.
data.comment: Displayed when other users are discovered to have created backup schedules.

data.name: MsgOtherSchedulersMe
data.value: You
data.comment: Displayed as part of a list of users who have created backup scedules.

data.name: MsgOtherSchedulersNotMe
data.value: Press OK if you wish to create an additional schedule. Press Cancel if you do not wish to create an additional schedule.
data.comment: Displayed when other users are discovered to have created backup schedules.

data.name: MsgScheduleNotAccessible
data.value: (Schedule not accessible)
data.comment: Displayed as part of a list of other users' backup schedules.
